li.a: Emergency Planning - A Guide for Parents

div.p: Information about the Governer's Executive Orders for April

img.title: icon
img.style: width: 250px; height: 148px; text-align: center; float: left;

p.span:
SCOPE Emergency Childcare Program Tuition is FREE for Essential Workers:
SCOPE will take place at Old Country Road Elementary School from 7am-6:30pm beginning on Thursday, March 19th. Registration information is found on line at scopeonline.us.

a.title: https://www.scopeonline.us/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Emergency-Child-Care-Parent-Info-3.27.2020.pdf
a.style: background-color: transparent; letter-spacing: 0.3px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(240, 76, 35); text-decoration-line: none;

p.a: SCOPE Education Services Emergency Child Care Programs

a.title: http://www.news12.com/story/41922557/which-workers-are-considered-essential-during-covid19-outbreak-this-list-breaks-it-down
a.style: background-color: transparent; letter-spacing: 0.3px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(240, 76, 35); text-decoration-line: none;

br.a: News12LI: Which workers are considered essential during the COVID-19 outbreak

p.span:
Mental health and support resources are available to our community. Please follow the links below for more in depth information. Our Community & Mental Health page has everything you need to know during COVID-19.
NYSED Mental Health Resources
LI Counseling Centers Hospitals Hotlines
NYS Office of Mental Health Managing Stress during COVID
HPS Student Support Services
Nassau County Mobile Crisis Team Website
To qualify for an exemption, students must receive local course credit or in other words, must pass the course linked to the Regents exam.

span.style: font-size: medium; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: The District hopes that you and your family are safe and well during this crisis. We miss our school community and want to hear how you are doing. To that end, please take a moment to complete our new survey: "Telling Our Story" during the COVID-19 pandemic. Thank you for sharing your stories with us.

span.style: font-size: medium; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(255, 0, 0);
font-size: medium; text-decoration: underline; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(255, 0, 0);
font-size: medium; text-decoration: underline; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(255, 0, 0);

img.title: our story
img.style: width: 225px; height: 114px; border-width: 1px; border-style: solid; border-color: rgb(127, 127, 127);

p.span: Altice (formerly Cablevision) is offering a free internet product for households currently without Internet access. If your household is eligible and interested in enrolling, parents are asked to call 866-200-9522. Through the prompts, select New Customer / New Service / New Internet.
Parent Tutorials & Resources: From logging into Parent Portal to How to use the Google Platform, a list of resources and tutorials are listed to help you through Distance Learning.
Grab & Go Food Program: Our breakfast and lunch food distribution program continues
to anyone 18 or under from 8:00 am – 12:00 pm at the following locations: Hicksville Middle School, Burns Avenue, East Street and Old Country Road. Grab & Go (En Español)

div.h2: A Thank You Letter from our BOE!
div.p: We as a Board extend our thanks for your continued support!
